title.narrative: Transition to a Diversified Economy: an inclusive, sustainable and just development approach for the Colombian coal mining regions

description.narrative: RWE, Uniper, Power Plant Rotterdam B.V. and other European energy companies source coal from Colombia to generate electricity. Climate change policies and the resulting decline in the use and production of coal will have significant negative effects on employment, public revenues and the local economy in the country’s coal mining region. This calls for the goal of creating viable and sustainable ‘beyond coal’ economic alternatives and decent new jobs in the region to adapt to this new reality. This development, however, is hampered by a number of factors. So far, there has been very little public debate in Colombia about the shift away from coal; there is a general lack of awareness of the challenges and the impact associated with this shift.An expected outcome after successful implementation is that the pilot project will contribute to the creation of sustainable and broader ‘beyond coal’ economic alternatives in the mining region in Colombia and other coal producing countries. It will also help to build social consensus in the region on the goals and pathways of local transition strategies and help to improve government policies in support of these strategies. Project results will also help to improve policies regarding mine closure and disengagement of the utilities and mining companies in and outside Colombia, and through initiatives and organisations like Bettercoal and the Colombian Mining Association.More investments in sustainable and inclusive economic alternatives will increase alternative decent job opportunities for workers now active in the coal mining industry, and will contribute ultimately to a more sustainable coal supply chain.
